intro: Astragalus thracicus var. jankae, commonly known as the Janké's milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, yellowish-pink flowers. The plant has compound leaves with numerous leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in Mediterranean climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
